meanings.definition: To rush out or forth with great force or speed.
meanings.sent1: The water was outrushing from the broken pipe.
meanings.sent2: She outrushed her competitors to win the race.
meanings.sent3: The dog was outrushing towards the squirrel, but it quickly climbed up a tree.
meanings.sent4: The wind outrushing through the open window felt like a powerful force.
meanings.sent5: The car outrushing on the highway was a blur of speed.

meanings.definition: The act of rushing out or forth with great force or speed.
meanings.sent1: The outrushing of water from the dam caused a flood.
meanings.sent2: The outrushing of students from the school gates signaled the end of the day.
meanings.sent3: The outrushing of confetti at the party made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The outrushing of emotions during the movie scene was intense.
meanings.sent5: The outrushing of air from the balloon made it fly high in the sky.
